meanings.definition: Make a noise similar to a hiccup, typically due to a spasm of the diaphragm.
meanings.sent1: She hiccoughed loudly after drinking her soda too quickly.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine hiccoughed before finally starting.
meanings.sent3: The baby hiccoughed just as the family was about to take a photo.
meanings.sent4: The broken speaker hiccoughed its distorted music into the room.
meanings.sent5: The machine hiccoughed and sputtered before coming to a halt.

meanings.definition: To make a repeated, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The typewriter hiccoughed as it printed the final page.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks hiccoughed into the night sky, lighting up the darkness.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet hiccoughed drops of water at irregular intervals.
meanings.sent4: The old floorboards hiccoughed under the weight of each step.
meanings.sent5: The wind chime hiccoughed in the breeze, creating a melodic tune.
